thread.title: Drive-In Theatre Night, inside church hall
thread.title_full: Drive-In Theatre Night, inside church hall

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Drive-In Theatre Night, inside church hall
text:
Drive-In Theatre Night, inside church hall Oct 16, 2015 
Belfast — Everyone is invited to enjoy an old-school evening in the Fellowship Hall of First Church UCC, Court and Spring streets, Friday, Oct. 23, from 6:30 to 8 p.m. 
This drive-in is indoors, but attendees can turn their chairs into “cars” to be detailed and waited upon by carhops. Bringing one’s own chair or just sitting in a provided one is fine too. On the screen will be an old Colonial Theatre movie — Roy Rogers’ “Trail of Robin Hood" from 1950, shown via an original 16mm projector along with a number of cartoon shorts. 
A sample “car” is displayed in the parlor, where there is a sign-up sheet for those who would like an actual ride that evening. There is no admission, but food will be sold with proceeds going to the church’s mission project. Everyone is invited to come and enjoy a fun evening, watching movies and eating popcorn and hot dogs “like we used to at the drive-in.” 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
